tests.title: children() to get the children of DOM elements
tests.fullTitle: Traversing DOM elements in Cypress children() to get the children of DOM elements

tests.title: closest() to validate the closest ancestor DOM element
tests.fullTitle: Traversing DOM elements in Cypress closest() to validate the closest ancestor DOM element
tests.code:
cy.get(".traversal-badge").closest("ul").should("have.class", "list-group");
// it is good example of using closest when traversal up through document

tests.title: eq() to retrieve a specific element based on index
tests.fullTitle: Traversing DOM elements in Cypress eq() to retrieve a specific element based on index

tests.title: filter() to retrieve DOM elements that match a specific selector
tests.fullTitle: Traversing DOM elements in Cypress filter() to retrieve DOM elements that match a specific selector

tests.title: find() to retrieve DOM elements of a given selector
tests.fullTitle: Traversing DOM elements in Cypress find() to retrieve DOM elements of a given selector

tests.title: first() to retrieve the first DOM element within elements
tests.fullTitle: Traversing DOM elements in Cypress first() to retrieve the first DOM element within elements

tests.title: last() to retrieve the last DOM element within elements
tests.fullTitle: Traversing DOM elements in Cypress last() to retrieve the last DOM element within elements

tests.title: nextAll() to get all of the next sibling DOM elements within elements
tests.fullTitle: Traversing DOM elements in Cypress nextAll() to get all of the next sibling DOM elements within elements

tests.title: nextUntil() to get all of the next sibling DOM elements within elements until another element
tests.fullTitle: Traversing DOM elements in Cypress nextUntil() to get all of the next sibling DOM elements within elements until another element

tests.title: not() to remove DOM element(s) from the set of elements
tests.fullTitle: Traversing DOM elements in Cypress not() to remove DOM element(s) from the set of elements
tests.code:
// using not to lacate all buttons that are not disabled:
cy.get(".traversal-button-states").find(".btn").not(".disabled").should("have.length", 3).and("not.have.class", "disabled");

tests.title: parent() To get parent DOM element of elements
tests.fullTitle: Traversing DOM elements in Cypress parent() To get parent DOM element of elements
tests.code: cy.get(".traversal-mark").parent().should("contain", "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet").and("contain", "quisque sagittis purus sit amet volutpat consequat.");

tests.title: parents() to get parents DOM element of elements
tests.fullTitle: Traversing DOM elements in Cypress parents() to get parents DOM element of elements
tests.code:
cy.get(".traversal-cite").parents().should("match", "blockquote");
// assertion that blockquote is located as one of the paremnts of cite element

tests.title: prev() to get the previous sibling DOM element within elements
tests.fullTitle: Traversing DOM elements in Cypress prev() to get the previous sibling DOM element within elements
tests.code:
// challenge: check if previous list item in UL is Espresso if actual is Sugar:
cy.get("#sugar").prev().should("contain", "Espresso");

tests.title: prevAll() to get all previous sibling DOM elements within elements
tests.fullTitle: Traversing DOM elements in Cypress prevAll() to get all previous sibling DOM elements within elements

tests.title: prevUntil() to get all previous sibling DOM elements within elements until other element
tests.fullTitle: Traversing DOM elements in Cypress prevUntil() to get all previous sibling DOM elements within elements until other element
tests.code:
// challenge: check if list items contains following fruits:
cy.get("#veggie").prevUntil("#fruits").should("have.length", 5).invoke("text").should("contain", "Apple").and("contain", "Banana").and("contain", "Blackberries").and("contain", "Cherries").and("contain", "Figs");

tests.title: siblings() To get all sibling DOM elements of elements
tests.fullTitle: Traversing DOM elements in Cypress siblings() To get all sibling DOM elements of elements
